image.altText: Woman speaks in parliament

props.synopsis: The NT government is set to urgently pass new bail laws today after the fatal stabbing of a Darwin supermarket owner, flagging an overhaul of youth justice laws is underway.

title.children: NT to pass urgent bail laws as government flags youth justice overhaul

image.altText: People attend the voting centre in Mitchell Street during the NT council elections. Image taken August 26, 2017.

props.synopsis: Â The Local Government Association of the Northern Territory has criticised a proposal to change how council mayors are elected in some jurisdictions.

title.children: Outcry over NT proposal to strip voters of right to elect local mayors

image.altText: Shuqin Li

props.synopsis: Members of Darwin's Chinese community are calling for federal Labor and the Coalition to reconsider their election promises to take back the lease of the Darwin Port.

title.children: Chinese community urges rethink on major parties' Darwin Port plans

image.altText: A man standing inside a room and holding out a machete to the camera.

props.synopsis: The 18-year-old charged with murder over the death of Darwin supermarket owner Linford Feick has faced court for the first time since the fatal stabbing.

title.children: Phillip Randel Maurice Parry faces court charged with murder of Darwin grocer

image.altText: The facade of a new police station in Darwin's northern suburbs

props.synopsis: The unstaffed Nightcliff Police Station stands opposite to where 71-year-old supermarket owner Linford Feick was fatally stabbed last week.

title.children: Concerns over $12m 'white elephant' police station opposite fatal stabbing site

image.altText: A digital illustration of a large housing development in the rural area, beside a lake.

props.synopsis: The company behind a controversial planned housing development in Darwin's rural area has relaunched its bid, years after it was rejected under a different name.

title.children: Proposal for 4,000 new Darwin homes relaunched years after rejection

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Prosecutors are outlining their case against Victorian woman Erin Patterson, who stands accused of using a poisoned meal to murder three relatives. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Prosecutors allege Erin Patterson's poisoning victim 'wondered' about different-coloured plates

image.altText: shac teal

props.synopsis: The Climate 200 founder lit a fire that could clear a path for independents to decide the next government. They say his influence ends there.

image.altText: A man stands with his arms crossed in front of a house next to an empty lot.

props.synopsis: The major parties have decided on a solution to Australia's housing crisis: build more homes. But some of the country's newest suburbs suggest it's not as straightforward as it seems.Â

title.children: 'What I feel is left out': The growing pains of Australia's newest suburbs

image.altText: Two men sitting on chairs in a church

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has made big promises on Russia's war in Ukraine but he's becoming an impatient broker.

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles as a crowd holds supportive signs behind him.

title.children: Trump dismisses 'fake' approval rating as Americans voice tariff fears

image.altText: Purple sign reads "voting centre"

props.synopsis: Applications for postal votes close tonight at 6pm but early voters are wasting no time having their say.Â

title.children: More than 4 million Australians have already voted. Major political parties take note

image.altText: Two men wearing glasses and suits behind the backdrop of the world map.

props.synopsis: The next federal government faces a world with drastic US policy changes, trade disputes, and ongoing wars in Europe and the Middle East. The ABC asked experts what the next Australian prime minister needs to address first to ensure the country is stable, safe and successful.

title.children: Australia faces 'lonelier' world with rules-based order crumbling

image.altText: Peter Dutton shakes hands with bandaged man

props.synopsis: Both major party campaigns have teams of advancers, staying one step ahead of their leader and preparing the media moments for the days ahead â all while trying to remain in the shadows.

title.children: Election 'roadies' know a single photo can derail a campaign day or worse

image.altText: People handing out A4 sheets of paper to a woman carrying a shopping bag on a street.

props.synopsis: Working from home is key for these voters in one of Australia's fastest-growing areas but as the election draws near many people here don't think any Labor or Coalition policy will help them much.

title.children: 'Disconnect' with major parties a major problem for this rapidly growing area

image.altText: Samreen takes a selfie with a scenic backdrop

props.synopsis: As debate around international student numbers intensifies, a report reveals they experience poorer mental health than their domestic counterparts.

title.children: What itâs really like to be an international student in Australia

props.synopsis: The Kangaroos confirm they have banned Channel 7 pundit Kane Cornes from talking to players and coaches over "vindictive attacks" aimed at North Melbourne stars.

title.children: 'Bullying behaviour': Clarkson and Kangaroos ban Channel 7 pundit from interviews

image.altText: a card that reads "with the compliments of HRH The Duchess of Sussex" on it

title.children: Three letters on a card from the Duchess of Sussex sparks debate about her royal title

image.altText: A collage of black and white photos featuring pilots. an Australian kangaroo logo and soldiers holding babies.

props.synopsis: As Communist forces surrounded Saigon, these RAAF members returned to Vietnam for a final humanitarian mission.

title.children: 'Babies were just being thrown over': The final missions of the Vietnam war

image.altText: nsw ambulances and police outside the westfield shopping centre at bondi junction after a mass stabbing event

title.children: 'Not good enough': Paramedic frustrated by delay to treating Bondi victims

image.altText: Melioidosis on a petri dish

props.synopsis: Melioidosis claims another two lives in Queensland, bringing the state's death toll to 28 from more than 200 infections following record wet weather.Â

title.children: Death toll rises from soil-borne disease after floods

image.altText: Woman in glasses smiles.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors say a DV murderer, who used a 30cm kitchen knife to repeatedly stab his former partner, blames her for his actions in an apology letter read at his sentencing.Â

title.children: Murderer who stabbed ex-partner 78 times accused of 'victim blaming'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with the public on a street.

props.synopsis: Both sides of politics are gearing up for a frenetic 72 hours of campaigning with Anthony Albanese planning to visit every state before election day.

title.children: Final campaign dash as Albanese sweats on Dutton suburban fightback

image.altText: Jan Massey smiles, wearing a neck scarf

props.synopsis: Dozens of HESTA super fund members told ABC News they weren't aware of the planned outage, despite HESTA announcing the seven-week freeze back in February.Â

title.children: Super fund members caught out without access in seven-week freeze

image.altText: A picture of St Kilda AFL coach Ross Lyon standing on the sidelines at Docklands looking out on the field during a match.

props.synopsis: Ross Lyon hits out at the VFL after Alix Tauru was suspended for four weeks before a two week bye.

title.children: Saints coach 'absolutely filthy' about rookie's suspension, takes aim at VFL

image.altText: Vaibhav Suryavanshi wears a helmet on his head

title.children: This 14yo is shattering cricket's 'youngest ever' records â why is it causing controversy?

image.altText: A man with his lips pursed looking sideways

props.synopsis: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's Liberals will form government with a minority, according to Canadian public broadcaster CBC.

title.children: Mark Carney's Liberals fall short of majority in Canadian election

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks while standing outside.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump acknowledges Australia's efforts to talk to him about trade and says he intends to speak to the Australian prime minister about the issue.

title.children: PM shrugs off Trump's 'throwaway comment' on Australia's efforts to call

image.altText: Pedestrians shelter from rain under umbrellas in a wet city.

props.synopsis: A run of showery and stormy days is soaking Australia's east coast, while a record drought across South Australia and Victoria continues to intensify.

title.children: A wind deviation responsible for SA, Victoria drought and the NSW soaking

image.altText: Purple sign reads "voting centre"

props.synopsis: Advance Australia is one of several relatively new groups aiming to replicate the success of activists on the left, but confronts a more fragmented right.

title.children: A constellation of conservative groups has altered the campaign landscape

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of Adolf Hitler standing in uniform beside Leni Riefenstahl

props.synopsis: Leni Riefenstahl made some of the Nazis' most notorious propaganda films, but denied any knowledge of the Holocaust until the day she died. This documentary tries to find the truth, and help us understand the rise of fascism today.

title.children: This woman made films for Hitler, but denied knowing about the Holocaust

image.altText: Two people, Darcy and Caitlin, sit outside a home with Caitlin holding a mug.

props.synopsis: Not a single property or room is affordable for people on Jobseeker, Youth Allowance or the Disability Support Pension in Western Australia, an Anglicare report finds.Â

title.children: WA rental crisis deepens amid 'catastrophic' price hikes, report finds

image.altText: A man near a shark in shallow water.

props.synopsis: A shark has been returned to the ocean after it became stuck in shallow waters off a South Australian beach.

title.children: Trio free shark stuck in shallow waters

image.altText: Two copies of the Bake with Brooki cookbook.

props.synopsis: Can you own a recipe? And what are the protocols if you take inspiration from another cookbook author's work?

title.children: Brooki Bakehouse has been accused of plagiarising recipes. But can you own one?

image.altText: Les Kiss holding a rugby ball at Sydney Football Stadium.

props.synopsis: As a former Australia rugby league representative, Les Kiss's journey to becoming the next Wallabies coach was unconventional, but there should not be doubts about his ability to do the job.

title.children: How Les Kiss went from rugby league winger to the Wallabies' next coach
